name: Derbor
description:
Nice little Canyon to do when the classics have too much flow. Not the most continuous, but the last part is nice, and the finish in the lake makes you forget about having to struggle through wood sometimes.

Approach

Go up on the orographically River Right, at the same height as the canyon starts, there is some wood stacked, there you turn right and follow the path to the river.

Descent

Some nice rappels interrupted by walking through blocks and wood. The only time it is more committed is the end where it has 6 drops in the same narrow.

Exit

Swim out to the right 50m to 100m in the lake and you'll get to a spot where the access to the lake is not private.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media
